plot outline: Janala tells the story about a man, Bimal, who decides to give a little back to his old school despite the fact he has very little money himself. As a child Bimal had a favourite corner classroom where he used to sit and daydream out of a broken window, and so when he finds himself back in his old school he feels compelled to replace the window. Bimal ends up using his fiancee Meera's savings - money she put aside for the child they're expecting - without telling her. Unexpectedly when he presents the window to the authorities it is rejected, and matters only get worse when Meera also seems to lose trust in Bimal.
title: The Window
plot: Bimal decides to contribute financially to his old school despite not having much money himself. He uses his fiance Meera's savings for this purpose which ends up creating a rift between the two.
